intro: Lipochaeta vittata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as coastal dunes and heathlands. Its leaves are narrow and often covered with fine hairs, and it produces yellow or pale pink flowers during the spring and summer months. Lipochaeta vittata is an important component of the local flora and is adapted to the dry and saline conditions of its native environment.
